title: Student Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Dayton
Interview Descriptions: Very Easy Going, Interviewer were very nice and asked about my past job experiences.  More conversational and wanted to learn more about my background, why I chose University of Dayton, and what led me to applying to this role.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to our team?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Dayton
Interview Descriptions: The was no interview it was just an application and a cover letter. You are also asked to include an updated version of your personal resume. Overall wonderful process that was completely stress free
Interview Questions: There was not an interview

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Dayton
Interview Descriptions: I met with the hiring manager to discuss the academic areas I felt like I could tutor in. Then had to get recommendations from my professors to ensure that I could actually tutor those particular areas of study.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Sustainment Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Dayton
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the branch director and the Chief technician. They introduced themselves and told me about their experience, and what the company does. They asked questions that focused mostly on the technical skills required for the job and my experience with AM. We went on some tangents about 3D printer debugging stories. There were few if any fluff questions like, 'what are your hobbies' or 'how would your co-workers describe you?'.Then I asked some questions.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with additive manufacturing?

title: Athletics Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Dayton
Interview Descriptions: Thorough interview process. You meet with basically every person in athletics staff and do round table interviews. The process typically lasts several hours. It can be a little stressful meeting with all of the different department leaders.
Interview Questions: What makes you a fit for UD

title: Bookstore Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview with basic questions on the position. Be aware of the position and the need for it to be accepted in this position. Take it as an easy interview and believe in yourself.
Interview Questions: How much in the quarter?

title: asst director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Dayton
Interview Descriptions: Committee chair sent an email to gauge my continued interest and my availability. The zoom  interview was scheduled for the following week. After the questions, the committee chair explained the next steps in the process. They were finishing up 1st round then deciding who would get 2nd interviews, then offer and acceptance.
Interview Questions: Why is diversity important to you?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: A phone interview was conducted for the first interview and that I was invited to come out for a second interview which met with three separate individuals.  They were going to have final candidates meet with the board and other staff members.
Interview Questions:
What type of atmosphere do you thrive in?
Describe your past work history.

title: Student Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Asked a lot of character questions. “What does diversity, equity, and inclusion mean to you?” “Why is diversity important in a workplace?” “How do you aline with the university’s marianist values?”
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Chemical Engineering Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very simple. I completed a short application and was asked to do an on-site interview within a week. At the interview, I was given a sit-down interview which was followed by a tour of the facility.
Interview Questions: What are your biggest strengths and weaknesses.

title: Hangar Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Dayton
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was easy, the staff in CSI is very nice and understand that we are students with busy schedules. Working here was great and would definitely recommend to anybody.
Interview Questions: How do you handle impatient customer?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Dayton
Interview Descriptions: Multi-step interview process: send in resume and supporting documents, phone interview round, on-campus interviews with multiple stakeholders from other admission counselors up through the Dean of Admission, as well as a presentation.
Interview Questions: What do you know about the Marianist charism and the way it is incorporated into the University's mission?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had a thirty minute phone interview with hiring manager and 2 of his staff members.  Easy to schedule. It was a good experience.  Asked great questions.  Friendly. Wish there was more time.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: After phone screening we scheduled a panel style interview. I was given a business scenario to discuss. I made my presentation and was asked the traditional interview questions regarding my approach to various topics etc. The strange thing was that I did not receive any follow up questions to my case analysis or no other feedback whatsoever. A week or so later I was told that the position had been offered to an internal candidate and they accepted. Somehow it felt like I was not a real candidate but instead a ghost candidate for paperwork purposes. I don't know it just made me feel uncomfortable.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself?

title: Entry Level Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH)
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and was contacted for a phone interview. About a week after the phone interview, I was contacted for an in person interview. I was contacted on a Thursday and asked to come in that coming Monday. I quickly prepared a requested presentation relevant to the position. The interview lasted from 8:30 am to 4:00 pm. Then I met with a few members of the search committee from 5:00-7:00 pm for dinner. Questions were relevant towards the position I was interviewing for and my current field. My age and how “young” I looked was brought up in my campus partners interview despite me being almost 30 years old. The day of interviewing consisted of me meeting around 30 people, going from one panel interview to the next. 

I was told I’d hear something within a few weeks and higher education “takes time” so be patient.  A week after the on campus interview, I was contacted to provide references. I immediately emailed back with 3 professional references. 

A month later I received a generic email stating they’re “unable” to offer the position.  No explanation of why despite me spending 10 hours there for an interview. Very disappointed that I wasted my time and didn’t get any explanation as to why I wasn’t chosen.
Interview Questions: Why UD?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: There was only one interview and it was pretty painless with the head of my department. It was a one on one interview. He mainly was concerned about if I had the ability to tutor undergraduate students. Plus my grades when I attended the University as an undergraduate student. Which were solid so it was pretty painless no way the interview took longer than 20 minutes.
Interview Questions: If I thought I would be able to tutor undergrad students in with my major.

title: Dining Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: no such interview for the dining services. every student gets 20 hours of work  with ease. Its a very good opportunity to get habituated with their culture over here in united states of america
Interview Questions: what are the safety measures you will take while working

title: Operational Event Management Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Simple organizational and leadership questions were put forth that includes managing individuals and teams at various critical scenarios that would adversely effect the company's profit. Also few scenarios were presented and my management skills were checked based on my response.
Interview Questions: How to handle unsatisfied customer?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online on a career website called handshake and was sent an email for a one to one interview . Screening was done by resume and a one to one interview was conducted. I dressed formally and few questions were asked from my resume.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was friendly, professional, and short.  I was interviewed by the Chair of the department.  The interview wasn't long because I had been working in the department as a teaching assistant during my masters degree program.
Interview Questions: Tell me what you like about teaching.

title: Intern Electrical Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Met my future boss for lunch, spoke about my qualifications in the field and discussed the job opportunity. He told me I'd be a great fit, and we discussed my availability. They were able to work with me through my class schedule at another university an hour away.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have that qualifies you for this role?

title: Purchasing Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Cleveland, OH) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview was pretty easy, was brought in and asked questions about previous employment and interests and major. It was not that bad. I think the process was pretty easy and the job is a good stepping stone for anyone who is planning a career in business
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience in the field of purchasing?

title: Events Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Dayton
Interview Descriptions: 2 group interviews and 1 interview with vice president of division. Was slightly overwhelming but great to meet so many potential colleagues. Final interview with vice president of division was intimidating but telling.
Interview Questions: Why UD?

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I have approached the Professor regarding the opportunity. As i applied it online, he reviewed my Skill sets and then reviewed my academic grades and performance and accepted my application.
Interview Questions: How will you keep up with the job?

title: Student Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: programming and trouble shooting, team playing skills, availability, previous experience, knowledge of university, social media management, training and documentation skills, what language do you like to code,previous employer and reason to leave
Interview Questions: what language do you like to code? why?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: IT is very easy ,professor ask me some algrithm and l told him everything,mOST OF THEM IS ABOUTc++ and alghtrim ,the professor is so nice to talk with .finally he smile and ask me to work with him
Interview Questions: DFS BFS LEVEL TRANVERSE OF BINARY TREE

title: Associate Computer Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with 2 group leads. Asked about resume, described general work flow, asked about skill levels / comfort level with example tasking. They couldn't guarantee job right away, but based on my good fit, a background/drug check, and a later offline budget discussion, they offered job. Met in person on first day of the job.
Interview Questions: Tell us about this project you worked on.

title: Junior Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I contacted a friend of my moms, he put me through to my current boss who also did the interview. Went into a meeting room and I was talked through my plans for the future and the ways UD can help me achieve them. The interview was more of a discussion.
Interview Questions: Work Experience

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application, received phone interview.  After initial phone interview, was invited to campus for in-person interview.  Met with several different departments, some formal, some informal.  Required to present to group I would supervise.
Interview Questions: How does your prior work history support the Marianist tradition espoused by the University of Dayton?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The entire hiring process is typical for a faculty job interview process. The only difference is that they require a skype presentation before the onsite interview, which is different from most other universities that often use telephone interview first. People there are very nice and you will feel very comfortable during the interview.
Interview Questions: How will you involve students in your research?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interview with about 5 professors from the department. They asked me basic questions about my skills, interests, and experience. They basically just wanted to make sure I was competent enough to do simple tasks for them. They wanted to make sure that I was organized, because organization is extremely important in the world of research.
Interview Questions: How have you used research in the past?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I spoke to the professor because I knew there was an opening and was offered the job. I went over my qualifications with the professor and once I accepted the position I had to fill out some paperwork. The interview overall was very easy basically all you need it to be able to communicate well and have gotten an A in the class.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a TA?

title: Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH)
Interview Descriptions: The process was very long and I met every person possible. The 3rd interview is when I met 12 people in one day...and I was not even told ahead of time that was going to happen.  Each interview had no less than 2 weeks between them with a total of 3 interviews...the first a phone screen that lasted less than 15 minutes and then 2 on site days. It was a frustrating process and the only reasoning given was that things take longer in higher education. All the core support people I would have worked with seemed like great people, but management was less than transparent. Money was never mentioned, so I assumed it was comparable to the salary requirements listed on my application. You know what happens when you assume. In comparison to the unnecessarily long interview portion...the offer portion goes much faster. To my surprise they barely do a background check and there is no drug test. Very Liberal environment I guess, but very disappointing as far as employment verification standards are concerned.
Interview Questions: So very standard in their questions...honestly it would have been easier to meet everyone at the same time in a panel interview instead of all the one on one's because everyone asked the same questions...tell us about yourself, why UD, what makes you think you are the person for the job...nothing new and very predictable. It made it easier, but a little on the boring side as well.

title: Circulation Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took a week. I applied online through a referral. My employer was very kind and welcoming. We discussed about the previous employees who worked with her and she explained the current role I was interviewing for.
Interview Questions: What were your greatest challenges in your current job?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Dayton
Interview Descriptions: First had a phone interview that lasted about 20 -20 minutes.  The phone interview was a group interview so it was a little hard to know who was talking.  Then had an on-site interview.  1 hour with 2 staff people, then 2 faculty were brought in towards the end.  The last interview was right after that interview with the chair/director.
Interview Questions: Pretty straight forward questions.  nothing really hard.  "how do you deal with difficult people?"

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Dayton
Interview Descriptions: This position on campus is basically determined by the supervisor whose research group you are in. As a graduate student, you may need to talk to the professor directly as an interview. Not like a commercial organization, the interview is pretty flexible.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to pursue a PhD? What is your interested area? What is your research or study plan?

title: Entry Level Staff Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Spanned from March to June. Fairly standard questions and process - your hiring board will likely know about the job you are applying for and not just be a recruiter.
Interview Questions: Why UD?

title: Student Operations Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: More than one interviewer, but it was incredibly comfortable and easy. All of the property managers are gathered into one area to ask you questions. If you are hired they will draft you from this interview onto their specific team. Questions are easy and typical for a job with no skill requirements.
Interview Questions: What is one time you had to lead a team or solve a problem?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: An email would go out during the year about applying for a RA/Fellow position. There would be several information sessions about the interview process and what the job would entail. Once you sent in all the materials for your application, an email would be sent out to set up an interview time. The interview would consist of three current employees of Housing and Residence Life. The interview would take 45-60 minutes. Once that individual interview was through, then a group interview would take place. Once both interviews were through, an email would be sent out in early February containing a job offering or not.
Interview Questions: What would you consider your strengths?

title: Intramural Sports Official Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Dayton
Interview Descriptions: Just show up to the training its a student job
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Dayton in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: submitted online applicaiton,  shortly after I was called to schedule a phone interview. It was only thru my prompting did I learn it was a panel interview. The phone interview started by UD person stating "we have about 15 minutes to speak to you, today" ..not to mention I could hear at least on person on the panel texting during the interview  ... they had already made up thier mind. 2nd time in 3-4 yrs appling for this job, they want young grads not long term employees
Interview Questions: Normal quesitons -- Why UD?

title: Telecounselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: UD has a base interview process for each department. First, you need to hit the GPA requirement. Second, there is a simple application to fill out. Third, you get an email response that you will be contacted by someone in the department. Fourth, you get an email to schedule time and must respond in a professional way. Fifth, you have a Skype interview. This interview consists on the average interview questions, strengths, weaknesses, etc. A key to mention is that they want to see how you handle the interaction. A Skype interview in it's very nature is a little more awkward just because you aren't truly face-to-face. After that, you're hired or not.
Interview Questions: Q: How would you interact if an angry parent called in?

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Dayton
Interview Descriptions:
Applied Online
3 round interview process
Final Round table interview
Interview Questions: Why are you the best fit for the University of Dayton?

title: Financial Aid Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Dayton
Interview Descriptions:
Applied in early January, got a call in mid Feb for a phone interview the next week. 
Lasted about 15 minutes, asked me questions about "Why UD?" "What did you like most about the school," etc.

Still waiting to hear back, but it happened about a week ago, so probably not.
Interview Questions:
What will you bring to this position?
Why should we hire you?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: There were several levels of interviewing before offers were given. There was a group process activity, a roundtable interview, and a three-on-one interview. All parts of the interview were intended to showcase various aspects of your personality and skills. Applicants got to meet various department leaders and potential coworkers during the processes, as the current employees were the ones who conducted many of the activities.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: You won't even get a call unless your resume and application materials exactly reflect everything in the minimum requirements.  Make sure your submission addresses each minimum qualification!  Everything is submitted online.  The process takes a VERY long time.  Often those not selected don't get notified until a final offer is made, accepted and the person has started in the job.
Interview Questions: They basically just took the job posting and framed each item into a question to see if I fit it.

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Hiring and interview process is lengthy. A lot of time between interview and finalizing the point of hire paperwork. Too many processes to go through to actual start date. Requirement for hire through Human Resources was held up due to no follow up on hiring manager.
Interview Questions: What has been your greatest accomplishment?

title: Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Dayton (New York, NY) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: simple and short. asked why you like this university and the city of Dayton. Meet with professors, director, co-workers. It took 3 hours. Have interview lunch with director. Visit lab and talk with students.
Interview Questions: How do you like to work for us?

title: Postdoctoral Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the University of Dayton's job website, and was contacted back in a timely manner by the hiring professor.  He was very friendly and open about what the position would entail, and invited me to campus for further interviewing and discussion.  Once hired, the human resources staff was incredibly helpful with making sure I got the most out of the benefits available to me.
Interview Questions: How much were you thinking for a salary.

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: Online I submitted a resume as well as a cover letter.  We then were called back to the office for interviews where we were asked about our experience as a student at the university.
Interview Questions: How I embody Marianist values

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interview with Chair if the department, with assistant Dean, with department as a whole.  Teaching demonstration- took over someone's class for the day, tour of campus, taken out to lunch,
Interview Questions: What courses would you create in the future?

title: Bookstore Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Dayton (Dayton, OH) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Called on phone, did poorly layed out group interview with open ended questions, the interview questions seemed to favor some candidates over others, overall was disappointed in their professionalism and friendliness toward what would be their future staff
Interview Questions: What does the UD Bookstore mean to you?
